table.caption: Elemental Marks
rows: Small, benign motes of elemental energy, like pebbles or water droplets, float around your head.
Your skin harmlessly feels blazing hot or freezing cold (your choice).
You have a faint scent reminiscent of your primordial nexus home, like petrichor, ozone, or smoke.
Sparks flicker in your eyes whenever you are angry or excited.
Patches of your skin are veined with stone, like marble or obsidian.
Your hair ripples as if moved by an unseen current.
table.name: Elemental Marks

table.caption: Underground Quirks
rows: You've seen few colors, instead primarily experiencing the world in shades of black and white.
Your eyes lack pigment and appear translucent.
You vaguely recall a phenomenon called "rain," during which fresh water fell from above.
Your ears are used to the echo of empty caverns, and the bustling noises of the surface are distracting for you.
The idea of a space with no ceiling terrifies you.
You're desperate to touch a cloud. You don't know what it will feel like, but you hope it's fluffy.
table.name: Underground Quirks

table.caption: Tall Tales
rows: You stumbled into a giant castle in the sky when you were younger, but no one believed your story. You aim to prove them wrong.
A loved one died mysteriously at sea. You swore the culprit was a sea leviathan everyone else dismissed as a myth, and you seek vindication and revenge.
Stories say you're descended from a legendary giant-killer, and you strive to uphold that legacy.

A city's legends claim the neighboring landscape is the work of some ancient giant sculptor or rampaging titanic beast—or is itself a sleeping giant. You seek to discover the truth of the land's origin.

A relative once returned home claiming to have found a strange island inhabited by ancient, larger-than-life creatures. Because of this, your family became the town laughingstock, and you seek to redeem your family's reputation.
Your sibling says giants and other enormous creatures are stories for children. You hope to slay such a creature and bring back proof of their existence out of spite.
table.name: Tall Tales

table.caption: Huge Behaviors
rows: The giant has a pet (a {@creature panther}, a {@creature wolf}, or a {@creature giant weasel}) that sits on the giant's lap or shoulder.
The giant swats at a murmuration of starlings as if it were a cloud of gnats.
The giant uses a {@item dagger|PHB} as a toothpick, a {@item greatsword|PHB} as a letter opener, or a pair of {@item Javelin|PHB|javelins} as knitting needles.
The giant carefully lifts Humanoids (cradling their heads to avoid injury) to see and hear them better.
The giant exclaims with admiration at the fine detail and exquisite articulation of the characters' armor.
The giant fidgets with the skulls of Humanoids.
The giant drinks from a barrel as a human would from a waterskin.
The giant takes a messy bite from a large melon held in one hand.
table.name: Size; Huge Behaviors

table.caption: Ancient Behaviors
rows: The giant addresses Humanoids as citizens of a fallen realm (equivalent to calling people in the real world "Babylonians").
The giant burdens conversation with irrelevant historical context.
The giant is curious about minute details of fashion, slang, and popular culture among Humanoids.
The giant is a hopeless procrastinator, always convinced there will be time later for any task.
The giant is prone to reminiscing about friends and family members who have died.
The giant is unwilling to accept any problems as truly urgent.
The giant is determined to wring every possible ounce of enjoyment from each day.
The giant is convinced that giants were meant to use their long lives to make a mark on the world.
table.name: Age; Ancient Behaviors

table.caption: Loud Behaviors
rows: The giant constantly (and loudly) encourages smaller creatures to speak up.
The giant's thoughtful "hmm" causes a rumbling vibration in the ground and the pit of listeners' stomachs.
The giant's exclamation of surprise or anger briefly sets listeners' ears ringing.
The giant's sneeze, snore, or sigh rattles windows or blows leaves off trees.
The giant's laughter feels like a small earthquake.
The giant's armor or weapons clang thunderously.
table.name: Volume; Loud Behaviors

table.caption: Proud Behaviors
rows: The giant ignores smaller creatures unless they offer the giant obeisance and flattery.
The giant refuses to bend over, sit, or kneel in the presence of smaller creatures.
The giant ignores the names of smaller creatures, referring to them with generic labels (such as "human" or "armor shaker").
The giant's first reaction to smaller creatures—even when threatened or presented with a terrible problem—is laughter.
The giant constantly demeans or patronizes smaller creatures, calling them "tiny," "insignificant," "babies," "pests," "vermin," or similar terms.
The giant won't speak any language but Giant.
The giant erupts in rage at the slightest sign of insult or disrespect from a smaller creature.
The giant addresses smaller creatures in a tone that drips with condescension and refuses to take them seriously.
table.name: Pride; Proud Behaviors

table.caption: Giants and the Ordning
rows: Very protective of that high status and angling to get even higher
Hoping to improve but not doing much to pursue an increase in status
Despairing after years of steady decline
table.name: Giants and the Ordning

table.caption: Cloud Giant Wealth
rows: A cloud giant seeks to gain wealth by investing in an adventuring party (perhaps giving the characters magic items or other valuables) in exchange for a share of the party's rewards.
A cloud giant hosts an art gala in a cloud castle to display their wealth, providing an opportunity for the characters to retrieve an important magic item from the giant's collection.
Wishing to one-up rivals, a cloud giant seeks adventurers to hunt exotic monsters for a lavish banquet.

With two nations on the brink of war, the characters discover cloud giants are betting on the outcome—and at least one giant is meddling behind the scenes to increase the likelihood of one side winning.
A cloud giant who recently lost a large amount of money on bad bets tries to recoup those losses by plundering a royal treasury or the adventurers' stronghold.
A cloud giant offers to buy the adventurers' services as an extravagant (and useful) gift for another giant.
table.name: The Ordning; Cloud Giant Wealth

table.caption: Fire Giant Skill
rows: A fire giant demands payments from miners transporting a rare ore through a mountain pass. The miners seek adventurers to intervene.
The characters acquire a broken magic weapon that only a renowned fire giant smith can repair.
The characters find a giant-crafted sword—a magical masterpiece; when word of their find gets out, the artisan's descendants come looking for the sword.
When the characters' enemies take refuge in a giant-built ruin, an ambitious fire giant offers to help the characters get inside in return for a share of the treasure.
A fire giant captures a renowned Humanoid smith in the hope of learning a new technique, and the smith's spouse begs the adventurers to help.
A fire giant offers adventurers an extravagant sum for metal ore retrieved from another plane of existence.
table.name: The Ordning; Fire Giant Skill

table.caption: Frost Giant Might
rows: Planning to claim all the credit, a frost giant seeks the help of powerful adventurers to defeat a foe the giant could never handle alone.
A frost giant wants help obtaining a {@item manual of gainful exercise} believed to be in a dragon's hoard.
A low-ranking frost giant prefers to be surrounded with weaker creatures and so leads a band of Humanoid brigands. A merchant council asks for aid against them.
A frost giant keeps a defeated foe's head as a trophy; the foe's family wants justice—and the head back—and asks adventurers for help.
Two groups of frost giants meet near a mountain pass. When their wrestling matches cause avalanches, travelers who rely on the pass ask for help.
A frost giant destroys works of Humanoid construction—such as bridges, barns, and walls—as a show of strength. Affected farmers beg for help.
table.name: The Ordning; Frost Giant Might

table.caption: Stone Giant Artistry
rows: A stone giant has been throwing stones near a city in the mountains. The mayor seeks help to protect the city from the destructive effects of the boulders.

A famous Humanoid sculptor attracts stone giants to the sculptor's town. The struggling town seeks protection from the rowdy giants, who thoughtlessly cause great damage because they believe they're in the dream world.
The characters' discovery of a huge, raw onyx attracts the attention of a stone giant who wants to carve the stone.
A stone giant traveler hones their skills by carving a relief into a city's walls. The city's rulers and masons beg for help.

Characters traveling underground encounter feuding stone giants who accuse each other of destroying their artwork; the characters can end the feud by finding the actual vandal (perhaps a third giant, a group of duergar, or an unwitting {@creature umber hulk}).
A stone giant tries to manipulate characters into killing a fierce rival.
table.name: The Ordning; Stone Giant Artistry

table.caption: Rejecting the Ordning
rows: A giant wanders into a settlement of Humanoids looking for an opportunity to use talents the giant's kin do not value, but the giant is greeted with suspicion and hostility. The giant seeks adventurers to help negotiate peace with the settlement.
Characters must find a wise giant who has pursued specialized knowledge instead of excellence within the ordning.
A giant tries to use the characters as pawns in a scheme to subvert the ordning and increase the giant's status.
A charismatic leader gathers giants of different kinds into a mighty war band, intending to conquer and settle lands inhabited by Humanoids who seek adventurers' protection.
A {@creature storm giant} asks adventurers to kill a revolutionary before the ordning is irrevocably disrupted.

A family of giants joined a cult of Elemental Evil and quickly took over the leadership, sorting its membership into a new hierarchy and creating dissension within the ranks—which the adventurers can use as they try to foil the cult's evil schemes.
A giant serving a demon lord attacks a town. The town's leaders ask the characters to retaliate against the giant's kin—which is exactly what the demon cultist was hoping for.
A group of giants seeks adventurers to deal with a surge of demon cult activity within the giants' community.
table.name: Rejecting the Ordning

table.caption: Gods of the Ordning
rows: Two hands, wrists crossed, with fingers pointing downward
Forked lightning bolt descending from a cloud partly obscuring the sun
table.name: Gods and Religion; Gods of the Ordning

table.caption: Annam's Children Adventures
rows: A storm giant prophet claims a revelation from Annam and begins a campaign of unification and conquest to prepare the way for the All-Father's return. A rival asks adventurers to stop the prophet.

A mysterious woman leads adventurers through a perilous dungeon to find an ancient giant queen's crown. In the end, she reveals herself to be Diancastra and either blesses or curses the adventurers, depending on how they acted.
A stone giant recluse asks adventurers to help stop a hill giant who has gathered a band of other giants and is plundering nearby giant steadings in Grolantor's name.
A fire giant priest of Hiatea warns a city of a titanic monster wandering nearby. The city asks adventurers for aid, and the priest offers to help.
A cloud giant priest of Iallanis seeks a neutral party to negotiate a truce between warring giant families whose conflict threatens a town.
Adventurers investigating a series of kidnappings discover a stone giant carrying people into the Underdark as an offering to Karontor.
Adventurers sent as emissaries to a cloud giant enclave find the place in chaos, sown by a devotee of Memnor in a bid to seize power.

Adventurers find a stone giant community in distress because its priest of Skoraeus has not returned from a pilgrimage to the Underdark. The giants suspect the priest has been captured by mind flayers.
Adventurers are shipwrecked in a mighty storm and rescued by storm giants, who believe the storm is a message from Stronmaus and are trying to discern its meaning.

A metallic dragon wyrmling asks adventurers for help stopping a fire giant who is slaughtering older dragons. The giant hopes to provoke a conflict between giants and dragons that will lead to Surtur cleansing the world with fire.
When winter stretches too long, food grows scarce and a priest of Thrym leads a hunting band to prey on the beleaguered people, who seek adventurers' protection.
A frost giant seeks help protecting a strange baby giant whom she believes to be a child of Annam who will herald a new age for all giantkind.
table.name: Gods and Adventures; Annam's Children Adventures

table.caption: Interloper Gods Adventures
rows: A giant who worships Vaprak leads ogres and ettins in a rebellion against their steading. The leaders ask adventurers for help.
Adventurers traveling underground become lost in a labyrinthine network of passages and are hunted by stone giant cultists of Baphomet.
A storm giant devotee of Demogorgon begins summoning the Prince of Demons in a sea cave, but before the ritual is complete, hordes of aquatic monsters swarm the area. Local fishers seek protection.
After being cast out from a steading, a frost giant devotee of Kostchtchie attacks caravans. The drivers hire adventurers as guards.
The characters discover a large horde of gnolls attacking a hill giant steading, but the more gnolls the hill giants kill (and eat), the more the giants seem to change into demonic forms.

The characters experience a series of small earthquakes while visiting a mountain town. Their investigation suggests Evil Earth cultists might be active nearby, practicing for a larger catastrophe. A stone giant leads the cult.
Adventurers encounter a longboat crewed by frost giant cultists of Evil Water, which is plundering a busy trade route.
Forest gnomes seek protection from Evil Fire cultists who are burning the forest, having grown impatient waiting for Surtur to cleanse the world in flames.
A storm giant cultist of Evil Air unleashes an endless storm upon a thriving seaport. The locals ask for help.
A fire giant opens a gateway to the Nine Hells in the heart of a volcano. Locals seek protection from the lava and marauding fiends.
table.name: Gods and Adventures; Interloper Gods Adventures

table.caption: Recluses
rows: Adventurers stumble upon a giants' enclave where a deadly plague wiped out most of the inhabitants. One survivor remains, tending the site and trying to hold back the ravages of time.

A new settlement in a remote region seeks to hire adventurers to get rid of a giant lairing nearby. The giant just wants to be left alone and is tired of having to move every few decades as other creatures crowd too close to the giant's dwelling.

Adventurers are hired to deal with a rampaging wild beast, but they discover the beast has a collar. The beast's owner is a giant who was forced to move recently, and the beast got lost trying to find its new home.
A wandering giant comes to a city looking for people who are knowledgeable about the world and might possess maps of remote regions. City authorities point the giant to the adventurers.

An approaching giant alarms the people of a small town, who ask the adventurers to protect them. But the peaceful giant is just searching for a new community of giants to join after fleeing a community ravaged by internal conflict. The giant agrees to leave the town in peace if the adventurers will help find a new home for the giant.
Adventurers stumble across the humble abode of a reclusive giant who is hungry for company and doesn't want them to leave.
table.name: Recluses

table.caption: Exiles
rows: Characters get entangled in the affairs of a criminal gang operating in a major city and eventually discover the gang's leader is a giant whose headquarters is a huge warehouse at the city's outskirts.
Adventurers discover a secret cult conducting sinister rites in a vast mansion where a giant lives in luxury.
A giant takes up residence in a city and demands a huge share of tax revenue in exchange for protecting the city from outside threats.

An adventurer receives an exclusive invitation to study a topic of interest (perhaps giants' sagas or religion), but the invitation seems suspicious—demanding secrecy, traveling to a remote place, and so on. The teacher is a giant living near a city who is trying not to attract attention.
A group of adventurers—supplied with superior equipment and information by their giant patron—pursues the same goal as the characters.

A giant who lives in a city asks the characters to take the giant's teenage child with them on their next adventure. (See the "{@book Giant Children|BGG|2|Giant Children}" sidebar for suggestions on how to represent the teenage giant with a stat block.)
table.name: Exiles

table.caption: Bands
rows: A band of giants is spotted near a town, and the adventurers are asked to dissuade the giants from coming any closer.
A raiding band of giants draws disaffected citizens of the region to join its ranks. The region's desperate despot hires adventurers to fight the giants.
A giant-led cult devoted to a demon lord or Elemental Evil wreaks destruction across the countryside.
A band of nature-revering giants seeks adventurers' help dealing with a corruption spreading through the local flora and turning animals into Aberrations.
A band of hunting giants has driven its prey—enormous beasts—into pastureland. The local farmers seek help.
Devout giants live a monastic life at a sacred site with vast magical power—power the adventurers require to deal with a cosmic threat.
table.name: Bands

table.caption: Families
rows: After a family of giants plunders a farming village of grain and livestock, adventurers are asked to track the raiders to their lair and prevent any further raids.
After a devastating storm, a lost giant child wanders into a settlement, looking for help getting home.
A giant begs adventurers for help after a family member becomes possessed by a murderous ghost.
Lost or stranded in the wilderness, the adventurers stumble upon a giant family's home.
Adventurers follow or track a fugitive to a giant family's home, where the villain hides from both the giants and the characters.
Characters seeking a mighty magical artifact learn it was lost during a battle against giants, and magical divination reveals it's now an heirloom treasured by a family of giants.
table.name: Family; Families

table.caption: Steadings
rows: A young giant looks for adventurers' help turning the rest of the steading, including the young giant's family, away from the worship of a demon lord.
The only possible source to learn about an ancient evil threatening the world is a steading of giants who preserved a detailed history of the evil's previous appearance thousands of years ago.
Giants raided a village and took several prisoners to their steading, and adventurers must free them.
An evil conqueror tries to recruit giants from a steading, which would be disastrous for the peaceful peoples standing against the conqueror. Adventurers are asked to make sure no alliance is made.

A dozen people arrive in a small town after escaping from captivity in a giant steading. Their fierce habits disrupt the peace in the town while they look for heroes who can help free the remaining captives.
A metallic dragon asks adventurers to help reclaim the dragon's lair, which has been occupied by giants.
table.name: Steadings

table.caption: Settlements
rows: Adventurers track marauding giants to a settlement where a cult of an interloper god dominates about half the steadings. The giants who remain faithful to the gods of the Ordning are barricaded in their steadings.
Adventurers are sent on a diplomatic mission to a giant sovereign to ask permission to open new mines in the giants' territory.
Adventurers need to infiltrate a giants' settlement to discover who is leading its ruler on the path to war.
The death of a giant monarch is an opportunity for adventurers to help a giant who has a peaceable attitude toward smaller folk to claim the throne.
Characters investigating a magical catastrophe discover that it engulfed a giants' settlement, and the giants need help dealing with its effects.
Adventurers are asked to deliver a ransom to a giants' settlement to secure the freedom of a very important captive, but the giants decide the adventurers would be even more valuable captives!
table.name: Settlements

table.caption: Hidden Rune Adventures
rows: While exploring an ancient giant ruin, adventurers encounter an agent of the Hidden Rune who tries to drive them from the ruin.
After adventurers discover an artifact made by ancient giants, an agent of the Hidden Rune approaches them and demands the item for the order's archive.
A collector hires adventurers to retrieve stolen items, but the thief has already sold the items to a giant. The chase could lead all the way to the Elemental Plane of Earth.
An agent of the Hidden Rune is unable to open the sealed entrance to an ancient ruin. The giant lures adventurers there, hoping they'll figure it out.
A comet appears in the sky, last seen when giants ruled the world. Adventurers discover there is information about the comet in the Hidden Rune's archive, if the giants can be persuaded to share it.
An agent of the Hidden Rune steals an important artifact and flees to another world, but the adventurers have a chance to follow.
table.name: Hidden Rune Adventures

table.caption: Eternal Throne Adventures
rows: Characters arriving in a remote village are greeted by a stern giant who urges them to move along quickly, as the town is under the giant's protection.
A wandering knight of the stewards asks adventurers for help closing a planar portal that is allowing demons to spill across the countryside.
A Fiend or Undead hunted by a knight of the stewards poses as human and tells adventurers the giant is a dangerous marauder.
A giant knight is convinced the adventurers pose a threat and must be eliminated.
Following rumors of a "dangerous giants' hideout" in the mountains, the adventurers discover a bastion of the stewards.

After defeating a terrible evil, the adventurers receive an invitation to a stronghold of the stewards, where they are welcomed warmly and offered a peaceful life in the bastion if they agree to help protect it.
table.name: Eternal Throne Adventures

table.caption: Worldroot Circle Adventures
rows: Giants of the Worldroot Circle need smaller adventurers to brave the caves beneath their world tree to stop whatever is gnawing or corrupting its roots.
A druid who saw the root of the world in a vision hires adventurers for protection on a pilgrimage to the site, which is guarded by the Worldroot Circle.
Long ago, the Worldroot Circle helped seal portals where invaders from another plane broke through. Now one of those portals has reopened, and the characters must find giants to reseal it.

Multiple oracles see visions of a great evil entering the world through a portal at its root, so adventurers are sent to find the place and ensure the portal doesn't open. They arrive to find giants of the Worldroot Circle locked in a losing battle to hold back the evil.
The characters find a magic staff made from a branch of a world tree, but the staff gives its owner haunting dreams that echo the Worldroot Circle's rites.
A giant of the Worldroot Circle comes to a city and insists a portal to the Far Realm has opened somewhere inside. Adventurers are tasked with helping the giant find and seal the portal.
table.name: Worldroot Circle Adventures

table.caption: Against the Giants
rows: Adventurers find a village completely deserted, with tracks leading to a hill giant steading. Can they rescue the surviving villagers and livestock before the {@creature Hill Giant||hill giants} eat them all?

A family of {@creature Stone Giant||stone giants} fell under the sway of Lolth and allied with Lolth-worshiping drow to raid the surface. Adventurers must break the alliance or eliminate the stone giants if necessary.
An especially harsh winter is accompanied by roving bands of {@creature Frost Giant||frost giants} and {@creature Winter Wolf||winter wolves} preying on travelers.

{@creature Fire Giant||Fire giants} send {@creature Hell Hound||hell hounds} into mine tunnels to chase the miners out, then send their own azer servants to plunder the mineral-rich mines. The miners seek help to reclaim their mines.

A clever {@creature cloud giant} plays several other powerful creatures against each other and against nearby Humanoids. Eliminating the giant will return the volatile situation to an uneasy status quo.
A {@creature frost giant} leads a mixed band of weaker giants in a campaign of bloodlust to honor Thrym or a demon lord.
After a villainous group slays a young {@creature storm giant}, the giant's parent unleashes an undiscriminating campaign of vengeance against any "interfering little gnats" living nearby.

As characters explore a steading belonging to one kind of giant (you can roll a {@dice d6} on this table to decide why the characters are there), they discover an honored guest of a more powerful giant kind who is coordinating the weaker giants' activities.
table.name: Against the Giants

table.caption: Clash of Titans
rows: Frost giants besiege a fire giant settlement, disrupting travel and trade across the region. Injured frost giants shelter in nearby towns, demanding the people there serve them while they recover.
A dragon and a giant, in the middle of a fierce battle, suddenly fall from the sky into a town square. Neither combatant is concerned about protecting the people around them.
Hired to guard a caravan heading to a remote mountain town, adventurers find the pass blocked with rockslides caused by stone giants at play.

A group of giants (perhaps members of the Stewards of the Eternal Throne, described in {@book chapter 2|BGG|2|Stewards of the Eternal Throne}) warns a city that the {@creature tarrasque} is approaching and asks for heroes to evacuate the city while the giants hold the monster at bay.
A terrifying storm lashes a fishing village for days. After helping people get to safety, the adventurers investigate the storm, and they discover a storm giant locked in battle with a kraken nearby.

After slumbering for centuries, a {@creature scion of Grolantor|BGG} (described in {@book chapter 6)|BGG|6|Hill Scion}, begins to stir. The residents of the farming village built on the sleeping giant's back seek help evacuating.
table.name: Clash of Titans

table.caption: Delve into the Past
rows: During a long drought, the water level of a lake lowers, revealing huge structures at its bottom.
A sinkhole releases strange monsters into the surface world, and characters who investigate discover a ruined stronghold in its depths.
An eccentric aristocrat finances an expedition to a remote ruin to retrieve giant-made art and artifacts.
The characters' research suggests the last known location of the {@item Axe of the Dwarvish Lords} (or some other artifact they want to retrieve) was in an ancient giant stronghold.
Adventurers tracking a monster discover its lair in an ancient giants' ruin. While they hunt the monster, they can also piece together the history of the place.
Characters exploring a strange ruin accidentally trigger magic that causes seven flying castles—including the one the characters are in—to rise into the sky from where they had fallen.
table.name: Delve into the Past

table.caption: Giant-Sized Schemes
rows: The ghost of a murdered giant monarch appears to the monarch's heirs and demands they claim vengeance. The heirs and the murderer end up in a wide-ranging conflict that threatens to devastate settlements near the giants' realm.
Convinced she is the rightful ruler of another giant's domain, a giant launches an invasion, heedless of the inhabitants of the lands between the giants' realms.
Believing his sovereign has violated the ordning by promoting an inferior giant instead of him, a scheming giant hires adventurers to undermine the sovereign's authority.
Seeking to impress a fire giant, a frost giant tries to bind a powerful elemental, but the elemental escapes and rampages across the region.
A dejected storm or cloud giant causes a drought or flooding across nearby farmlands.

After being insulted by a giant sovereign, a noble giant schemes to open a portal to the Abyss and summon a demon lord to destroy the sovereign's settlement. The site becomes a festering sinkhole of evil as demons roam the surrounding area.
table.name: Giant-Sized Schemes

table.caption: Into the Giant Realms
rows: A fissure opens during an earthquake, and ordinary means can't determine its depth. Adventurers are asked to explore it and determine the source of the light that is barely visible far below.
Characters find a coded journal in a dragon's treasure hoard, indicating a path to a hidden paradise.
Adventurers find a giant-sized ring inscribed with the sigil sequence for a teleportation circle.
An enormous stone archway is carved with symbols that, when touched in the correct sequence, activate a portal.
A strange map shows a road where no road exists. During solstices, the road appears and stretches in an impossible direction to a mysterious destination.
Characters acquire a broken piece of an artifact that magically guides them to the location of another piece, which is in a realm of giants.
table.name: Into the Giant Realms

table.caption: Boss Assignments
rows: Thieves stole the giant's most precious treasure and fled into the sewers, where the giant can't follow. Hunt the thieves and retrieve the treasure.
A rival gang is encroaching on the giant's territory. Spy on these rivals, and identify the best place for the giant to strike to shut them down for good.
Somebody who works for the giant is stealing. Find out who it is, and make sure they never think about double-crossing the giant again.
The giant has a score to settle with a powerful foe (perhaps a dragon, a {@creature beholder}, or another monstrous crime lord). Make sure the boss survives!
The boss wants a treasure that's being held in an underground refuge the giant can't enter. Plan and execute the perfect heist.
Another group of adventurers refuses to serve the boss anymore. Find them and convince them to return, or join forces with them to topple the giant.
table.name: Boss Assignments

table.caption: Financier Assignments
rows: Follow a map found in an ancient tome to a long-forgotten ruin in search of treasure or lore.
Find a new route around or across inhospitable terrain such as a desert or ocean.
Delve into the Underdark in search of deposits of rare magical crystal, and map your route so miners can retrace it.
Sabotage the business of a rival giant.
Guard a wagon or caravan hauling goods to a remote settlement of giants.
Venture into a desolate wasteland to find the undiscovered ruined city at the center and identify the catastrophe that devastated the region.
table.name: Financier Assignments

table.caption: Seer Assignments
rows: Help the giant re-create an ancient ritual that should reveal an omen or revelation from Annam.
Steal the research notes of some ancient sage (perhaps a dragon or a yugoloth), which hold information pertinent to Annam's activities.
Explore the ruins of an ancient temple to Annam, looking for records of revelations or prophecies.
Follow a devastating storm across the countryside, carefully mapping its path and cataloging the destruction left in its wake.
Brave a dragon's hoard to steal a device that tracks the positions of invisible celestial bodies.
Search for clues pointing to the location of the {@item Adze of Annam|BGG} (described in {@book chapter 5|BGG|5|Adze of Annam}) or some other artifact related to the gods of the Ordning.
table.name: Seer Assignments

table.caption: Sovereign Assignments
rows: Steal intelligence from an enemy giant sovereign.
Weaken or remove a rival to the sovereign's rule—an ambitious general, fanatical priest, or jealous sibling.
Root out corruption or disloyalty among the giants, and eliminate their abuse of their strength to exploit the settlement's smaller inhabitants.
Bring gifts to a powerful dragon—and convince it not to destroy the settlement of giants.
Suppress (or secretly aid) an underground rebellion among the smaller folk of the settlement.
While pretending to entertain visiting diplomats, try to discover their secret reason for visiting.
table.name: Sovereign Assignments

table.caption: Tutor Assignments
rows: Capture and document the elemental hulks (see {@book chapter 6|BGG|6}) or other creatures that inhabit a remote valley, island, or cavern.
Explore the effects of a planar nexus on spellcasting, creatures, and magic items.
Delve into an ancient ruin to discover the nature of the plague, conflict, or magical catastrophe that exterminated the giants who once lived there.
Find the secret demiplane where an ancient city of giants was hidden to avoid catastrophe.
Find a set of artifacts that was plundered and scattered when a settlement of giants fell.
Plumb the secrets of a sect of giants that was wiped from the face of the earth by the gods' wrath.
table.name: Tutor Assignments

table.caption: Warleader Assignments
rows: Take out a champion or commander at the rear of a mass of enemy forces.
Oversee the defense of a supply depot when enemies attack.
Sabotage or steal a powerful magical weapon before enemies can use it against the giant's forces.
Gather information on enemy troop numbers, placements, composition, or supply routes.
Protect the giant's forces from an attacking dragon.
Suppress the activities of bandits and rebels within the giant's territory.
table.name: Warleader Assignments

table.caption: World-Shaking Events
rows: A giant who claims prophetic inspiration from Annam unites scattered bands of giants into a powerful political and militaristic force.
The death of a storm giant sets off a wide-ranging struggle among various giant leaders to fill the resulting power vacuum.

A cataclysmic disaster (such as a volcanic eruption, unending winter, or relentless storm) displaces both giants and smaller folk from their homes; only later do adventurers discover giants caused the disaster.
A mighty army led by giants launches an invasion of its neighbors, secretly motivated by the desire to access an ancient ruin in neighboring territory.
Humanoids mobilize to overthrow their giant oppressors, but the Humanoids are hopelessly outmatched in battle.
One of the giants' organizations described in {@book chapter 2|BGG|2|Organizations} is founded or comes to this world for the first time.
A group of giants sailing in enormous boats makes landfall in an area inhabited by Humanoids, marking each people's first awareness of the other and the lands they inhabit.

A small but growing number of giants believe the adventurers might be the fulfillment of an ancient prophecy that means they will bring about the return of Annam—and either the downfall or the resurgence of the giants.
table.name: Campaign Events; World-Shaking Events

table.caption: Howling Iceberg Tunnels
rows: A planar portal leading to the Frostfell
A planar portal leading to Pandemonium
The cavern where the Frostfell Shard rests
table.name: Howling Iceberg Tunnels

table.caption: Cloud Giant Bag Items
rows: A gilded birdcage, large enough to hold a Medium creature, worth 50 gp
A giant-sized silver ring set with blue crystals, worth 75 gp
A large, gaudy citrine pendant carved to look like the sun, worth 90 gp
A giant-sized brass spyglass worth 100 gp
A life-sized malachite statue of a vulture, worth 110 gp
A tall electrum goblet inlaid with jade, worth 115 gp
A giant-sized silk dressing gown worth 125 gp
A 3-foot-tall turquoise idol depicting Memnor, worth 150 gp
Two 1-foot-tall golden eggs, each worth 100 gp
A large platinum mask worth 200 gp, which can depict two expressions—one of grand joy and one of deep sorrow—depending on its orientation
table.name: Cloud Giant Bag Contents; Cloud Giant Bag Items

table.caption: Fire Giant Bag Items
rows: A battered, giant-sized pewter bowl and spoon
A giant-sized leather apron stained with soot
A branding iron of the giant's family name
A large pot of metal polish
An old iron warhammer (used to emboss metal)
120 feet of thick hemp rope coated in fire-retardant lacquer
A diagram showing how to make a spiked tower shield
A 3-foot-tall ceramic mug with golden paint
A giant-sized ivory beard comb worth 50 gp
Fragments of a fire opal, worth 60 gp
A delicate, blown-glass flower wrapped carefully in gauze, worth 80 gp
table.name: Fire Giant Bag Contents; Fire Giant Bag Items

table.caption: Frost Giant Bag Items
rows: A large bronze bell with no clapper
A giant-sized wineskin, half-filled with wine frozen to slush
A necklace made of griffon beaks and skulls
The jagged claw of a white dragon with ice still riming its tip
A giant-sized fur cloak, ripped and patched in multiple places
A rusty longsword used to skin animals
A sack of dried meat strips, with "Wolf Treats" stitched in Giant on the front
Three ivory tusks, each worth 10 gp
Two polar bear pelts, each worth 20 gp
A massive, gold-tipped war horn worth 50 gp

table.caption: Outlands Aberrations
rows: An {@creature aboleth} travels in a muck-filled, orbicular carriage, seeking to better understand the Outer Planes in preparation for a future world-domination scheme.

A {@creature beholder} influenced by {@book the Abyss|MPP|0|The Abyss} has compound eyes and looks like a floating, cyclopean fly head. It promises not to destroy the characters if they bring it a corpse it has never tasted before.
A dejected {@creature red slaad} wishes to be reunited with its {@creature slaad tadpole}, but it isn't certain where—or in what—it implanted its egg.
A hirsute, axe-wielding {@creature flumph} influenced by {@book Ysgard|MPP|0|Ysgard} quests across the land, seeking legendary beasts to slay and epic songs to sing.
table.name: Outlands Aberrations

table.caption: Outlands Beasts
rows: An awakened {@creature giant scorpion} owns a custom-made boat and runs a ferry business along a prominent river. It offers its services to characters in need.

A {@creature triceratops} influenced by {@book Mechanus|MPP|0|Mechanus} and composed of simple geometric shapes charges creatures that enter the angular canyons it inhabits. It moves only in straight lines and turns only at right angles.
{@creature Stirge||Stirges} drawn from countless worlds congregate in a tornado-sized, bloodsucking cloud that threatens a gate-town.
A desiccated {@creature giant frog} influenced by {@book Pandemonium|MPP|0|Pandemonium} screams whenever it opens its mouth. Its interior is even noisier.
table.name: Outlands Beasts

table.caption: Outlands Celestials
rows: An {@creature empyrean} calls for aid in taking back a corner of the Outlands overrun by demons.
Wearing grim armor and displaying a rust-colored horn, a {@creature unicorn} influenced by {@book Acheron|MPP|0|Acheron} challenges all it encounters to mortal combat.

A fallen {@creature deva}, now neutral aligned, is on permanent vacation. The mellow angel is a font of multiversal secrets, but it shares them only with strangers who prove themselves more relaxed than it.

A {@creature couatl} influenced by {@book Limbo|MPP|0|Limbo} has color-changing wings and insists passersby convince it that they're worthy of existing. If the couatl isn't convinced, it has a 50 percent chance of either attacking or wandering off.
table.name: Outlands Celestials

table.caption: Outlands Constructs
rows: A tyrannical {@creature homunculus} rules over the small domain of its long-lost archmage master.
A beautiful but vain {@creature flesh golem} influenced by {@book Arborea|MPP|0|Arborea} insists on following a character until the character sketches, sculpts, or otherwise artistically renders it.

A gang of inquisitive {@creature Monodrone||monodrones} and its {@creature duodrone} leader insist on following a character, saying they expect that individual's doom to be "statistically noteworthy."

A {@creature clay golem} influenced by {@book the Beastlands|MPP|0|The Beastlands} has been transformed into the walking hive that's home to numerous {@creature Swarm of Wasps||swarms of insects (wasps)}.
table.name: Outlands Constructs

table.caption: Outlands Dragons
rows: An {@creature ancient gold dragon} disguised as a canary gives the characters a nonmagical item and offers them Bahamut's best wishes.

A lawful good {@creature Faerie Dragon (Violet)||faerie dragon} with wings like stained glass has been influenced by {@book Mount Celestia|MPP|0|Mount Celestia}. It seeks the characters' aid in recovering a stolen {@item holy avenger}.
A {@creature time dragon wyrmling|MPP} (presented later in this book) wants help constructing a magical structure that will be important in the future.
A neutral evil {@creature adult silver dragon} with dull, gray scales has been influenced by {@book Hades|MPP|0|Hades}. It demands a toll from any who crosses its domain.
table.name: Outlands Dragons

table.caption: Outlands Elementals
rows: {@creature Water Elemental||Water elementals} travel in a group that looks like a long, wandering river.
Some skull-headed {@creature Azer||azers} have been influenced by {@book the Nine Hells|MPP|0|The Nine Hells}. They escort a heavily armored caravan of rare ore to the gate-town of Ribcage.
A wounded {@creature mud mephit} asks the characters to help it deliver a sealed package to a leader in a nearby gate-town.

A wealthy {@creature dao} that glistens with gemstones has been influenced by {@book Arborea|MPP|0|Arborea}. It leads a parade of glimmering {@creature galeb duhr} between gate-towns as part of a shopping spree for precious rocks.
table.name: Outlands Elementals

table.caption: Outlands Fey
rows: Revelers joined a group of {@creature Satyr||satyrs} in their festivities. As the satyrs' celebration has continued for over a year, the revelers seek the characters' help in extricating themselves without offending their hosts.
A kindly {@creature green hag} influenced by {@book Elysium|MPP|0|Elysium} invites passersby to join her for tea in her cottage made of sweets. She makes some of the best cookies in the Outlands.

A pack of {@creature Blink Dog||blink dogs} tracks a band of {@creature Maelephant|MPP|maelephants} (presented {@book later|MPP|1|Maelephant} in this book) to prevent them from spoiling lands influenced by the Upper Planes.
A gnarled {@creature dryad} influenced by {@book Carceri|MPP|0|Carceri} seeks to entrap creatures within the root-snarled, prison-like cavern beneath her grove.
table.name: Outlands Fey

table.caption: Outlands Fiends
rows: A {@creature nycaloth} seeks to capture several monochromatic {@creature Hell Hound||hell hounds} influenced by {@book Gehenna|MPP|0|Gehenna}. The yugoloth seeks to sell the hounds to Fiends participating in the Blood War.

After being ambushed by a rival, a {@creature night hag} merchant offers a reward to characters who help her recover her lost inventory: several dozen stray {@creature Larva|DMG|larvae} (see the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}).
A hero requests the characters' help in gaining the aid of a legendary steed called a nic'epona, a {@creature nightmare} influenced by one of the Upper Planes.
Rival {@creature Incubus||incubi} seek to recruit the characters to serve either a {@creature balor} warlord or a {@creature pit fiend} general whose fiendish armies are prepared to clash nearby.
table.name: Outlands Fiends

table.caption: Outlands Giants
rows: Several {@creature Cyclops||cyclopes} refuse to let the characters pass through a region where they're constructing a massive ring of beautifully carved standing stones.

An {@creature ettin} influenced by {@book the Beastlands|MPP|0|The Beastlands} has one head with bovine features and one head with lupine features. It desperately needs help finding something both heads are willing to eat.
A {@creature storm giant} seeks the characters' help in finding an offering of significant worth and size to impress the god Annam.
A jade-skinned {@creature oni} from Bytopia has become separated from the spirit she was bound to protect. She requests aid in catching up to her lost ward.
table.name: Outlands Giants

table.caption: Outlands Humanoids
rows: The characters need to find a wandering {@creature priest} who alone knows the ritual necessary to open a specific portal.
Several gnome {@creature Mage||mages} seek help recovering their walking castle from a band of aggressive, spine-covered {@creature lizardfolk} influenced by {@book the Abyss|MPP|0|The Abyss}.
The characters stumble across a youthful or elderly {@creature commoner} who doesn't know how they came to be in the Outlands and who wants only to go home.

A {@creature bandit captain} and his gang seek the characters' help as they plan a heist in the realm of an immortal being, like the {@book Realm of the Norns|SatO|_UNKNOWN} or {@book Wonderhome|SatO|_UNKNOWN} (see {@book Sigil and the Outlands|SatO} for details on both locations).
table.name: Outlands Humanoids

table.caption: Outlands Monstrosities
rows: The characters are hired to recover cargo from a crashed vessel brimming with rare technology, but the wreckage is overrun with {@creature Rust Monster||rust monsters}.

The characters have to retrieve a treasure from a group of mischievous {@creature Sprite||sprites}. The sprites are secretly defended by {@creature Mimic||mimics} influenced by {@book Elysium|MPP|0|Elysium} that take the form of tiny, whimsical cottages.
A pride of {@creature Displacer Beast||displacer beasts} stalks a band of traveling merchants. The merchants seek protection from the predators hunting them for sport.

A {@creature drider} influenced by {@book Arborea|MPP|0|Arborea} runs a {@creature giant spider} ranch. She hires the characters to hunt a rare breed of {@creature sunfly|MPP} (detailed {@book later|MPP|1|Sunflies} in this book) that, when fed to her spiders, will allow them to produce a remarkable type of silk.
table.name: Outlands Monstrosities

table.caption: Outlands Oozes
rows: A yugoloth arms dealer has captured a hundred {@creature Gray Ooze||gray oozes} and seeks to sell them in the gate-town of Rigus as a weapon capable of destroying Acheron's floating cubes. A rival hires the characters to steal and dispose of the oozes.

Within a {@creature gelatinous cube} influenced by {@book Gehenna|MPP|0|Gehenna} floats a gigantic fiendish skull. Numerous Fiends revere the cube and interpret depraved schemes and threatening orders from its quivering. A Celestial seeks aid in destroying the cube.

A bog in a region influenced by {@book Carceri|MPP|0|Carceri} is swamped with countless {@creature Black Pudding||black puddings}. The characters are hired to recover a lost relic from the bottom of the bog.

A chef in the gate-town of {@book Tradegate|SatO|_UNKNOWN} wants the characters to retrieve royal jelly from a hive of giant bees (use the {@creature giant wasp} stat block). He doesn't note that the hive's honey takes the form of sweet-tasting {@creature Ochre Jelly||ochre jellies}.
table.name: Outlands Oozes

table.caption: Outlands Plants
rows: A young {@creature treant} wants to put down roots. It asks the characters to help it travel around the Outlands so it can find a suitable place to call home.

A {@creature myconid sovereign} has convinced a group of {@creature Githzerai Monk||githzerai monks} to abandon their teachings and follow its path to serenity. Another githzerai hires the characters to oust the fungal guru.
An herbalist has cultivated a unique breed of {@creature Gas Spore||gas spores}. She hires the characters to convey the spores to her buyer without setting off the fungi.

A resident of the gate-town of {@book Ecstasy|SatO|_UNKNOWN} is missing. His garden of {@creature Twig Blight||twig blights}—influenced by {@book Elysium|MPP|0|Elysium} to resemble topiary sculptures—haven't been fed and now sow chaos in town.
table.name: Outlands Plants

table.caption: Outlands Undead
rows: The characters find a trapped {@creature crawling claw}. Rather than attacking, the severed hand can lead the characters to the thankful immortal who lost it.

A {@creature banshee} influenced by {@book Acheron|MPP|0|Acheron} appears as a fallen knight-commander with a legion of {@creature Specter||specters}. Guardians of the gate-town of Rigus hire the characters to help banish the phantom army.

A {@creature lich} seeks to dominate the gate-town of Hopeless and see it dragged into Hades with himself as its ruler. Citizens of the gate-town entreat the characters to keep the gate-town hopeful enough that it doesn't fall into the Lower Plane.
Several confused {@creature ghost} {@book petitioners|MPP|0|Petitioners} have become lost. They seek someone to pass judgment on their lives and deliver them to the proper planes.

table.caption: Portal Quirks
rows: One-Way. The portal functions only one way, either into or out of Sigil. The portal isn't visible or detectable from the exit side.
Shifting. One end of the portal moves in a pattern between different locations in Sigil or the destination plane.

Slow. After a creature enters the portal, {@dice 2d4} days pass before the creature appears at its destination, during which time the creature is trapped in a stasis and is unaware of the passage of time.
Taxing. The portal's energy is unstable. A creature that passes through the portal must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.
Temporary. The portal allows only {@dice 1d6 + 6} travelers to pass through in either direction, then vanishes.
Tumbling Lock. Every time the portal is opened, it requires a different portal key.

Coterie of Cakes,* Revolutionary League,* Undivided* (see the "{@book Undersigil|SatO|2|Undersigil}" section later in this chapter for these factions)
table.name: Sigil Gazetteer; Sigil Wards

table.caption: Prison Inmates
rows: A chaotic evil {@creature storm giant} conquerer who darkened Sigil's skies with storm clouds
A disheveled wizard named Gifad (chaotic neutral, human {@creature mage}) who claims to hail from the future
Koe, a fiery-winged, chaotic neutral {@creature deva} imprisoned for smuggling weapons forged on Mount Celestia to Fiends on both sides of the Blood War
A clone of Manshoon (lawful evil, human {@creature archmage}), an infamous masked archwizard from the world of Toril, who insists he has been framed
A {@creature cuprilach rilmani|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) that killed a former factol to preserve the Balance
A malevolent cosmic force manifesting as a {@creature planar incarnate|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) that feeds on entire realities
A nameless, chaotic evil {@creature doppelganger} who has impersonated every factol in Sigil
A supernatural {@creature assassin} who targets only former mortals
A world-destroying Construct (use the {@creature kolyarut|MPP} stat block) whose creator is still at large
A {@creature decaton modron|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) that turned itself in after a {@creature pentadrone} under its command malfunctioned and abandoned its post
A {@creature darkweaver|MPP} guilty of trying to eat a {@creature dabus|MPP} (both stat blocks are in {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP})
A {@creature kraken} that briefly drowned one of Sigil's wards by using portals to aquatic planes
table.name: Prison Inmates

table.caption: Spells for Sale
rows: {@spell Comprehend languages}, {@spell detect magic}, {@spell disguise self}, {@spell feather fall}, {@spell illusory script}, {@spell protection from evil and good}, {@spell shield}, {@spell Tenser's floating disk}
{@spell Arcane lock}, {@spell darkvision}, {@spell detect thoughts}, {@spell hold person}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell knock}, {@spell Nystul's magic aura}, {@spell warp sense|SatO}*
{@spell Dispel magic}, {@spell fly}, {@spell glyph of warding}, {@spell magic circle}, {@spell sending}, {@spell tongues}
{@spell Dimension door}, {@spell fabricate}, {@spell gate seal|SatO},* {@spell locate creature}
{@spell Contact other plane}, {@spell legend lore}, {@spell planar binding}, {@spell Rary's telepathic bond}
table.name: Spells for Sale

table.caption: Bazaar Shops
rows: Boastful human hunter ({@creature assassin}) who sells hides and armors made from creatures she has slain—such as ankheg breastplates, angel-feathered cloaks, and horned gorgon shields
Celestial-owned bookstall carrying holy texts, illuminated manuscripts, and divine stationary
Boutique where a {@creature darkweaver|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) with an eye for fashion weaves the latest styles out of pure shadow
Food stall catering to creatures of a specific type
Sweltering iron shack where a {@creature fire giant} blacksmith and his two {@creature magmin} helpers craft sturdy weapons with harmlessly smoldering pommels
Pawn shop that specializes in portal keys
Souvenir shop full of chintzy planar trinkets that might all be Tiny {@creature Mimic||mimics}
Contractor hiring monsters to defend dungeons on other worlds
table.name: Shopping in the Bazaar; Bazaar Shops

table.caption: Sigil Adventure Hooks
rows: A lost soul asks the party to escort them to the home of their deity—who no one's ever heard of.
A barrister begs the characters to serve as witnesses during a trial in the {@book High Courts|SatO|2|High Courts}, but the characters have no memory of witnessing a crime.
A {@creature cranium rat squeaker|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) with an important secret needs help avoiding foes and finding its swarm elsewhere in Sigil.
Refugees entreat the characters to help them find a safe new home in Sigil.
The characters learn that a terrifying war machine is being transported through Sigil for use in conquering a Material Plane world.
A shop or tavern owner hires the characters to track down a deadbeat patron—a {@creature solar}, a {@creature pit fiend}, a {@creature death knight}, or other powerful being.
A group tries to kidnap a character, as the character is the key to a portal the group plans to use.

A villain looks remarkably like one of the characters, enough so that a {@creature kolyarut|MPP} or {@creature cuprilach rilmani|MPP} (both detailed in {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) mistakes the character for the scoundrel.
An {@creature archmage} new to the city offers to reward the characters with a magic item if they serve as their touts and sedan chair carriers for a day.
A {@creature dabus|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) requests the characters' aid in removing someone or someplace from Sigil before the Lady of Pain learns of it.
table.name: Sigil Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Faction Missions
rows: A factol hires the characters to dig up dirt on a rival faction leader.
The characters must infiltrate another faction's headquarters and steal a priceless item.
A faction leader hires the characters as bodyguards for an important city event at the {@book Hall of Speakers|SatO|2|Hall of Speakers}.
Suspicious of their own ranks, a factol hires the characters to root out a spy.
A factotum secretly offers the characters a hefty reward to break someone out of the {@book Prison|SatO|2|Prison}.
After a public spat with another faction leader, a factol goes missing. Their second-in-command hires the characters to investigate.
table.name: Faction Missions

table.caption: Sigil Calamities
rows: Sigil begins to shudder daily at peak and antipeak, causing a citywide panic.

Waves of arcane blackouts sweep across Sigil. During these events, magic items have their effects suppressed, spells behave unpredictably, and portals cease to function. The {@book Incanterium|SatO|2|Incanterium} is to blame.
Without warning, the Lady of Pain sends two-thirds of Sigil's population to {@book the Mazes|SatO|2|The Mazes}. It's up to the characters to figure out why.
Reliable portals throughout Sigil begin to malfunction. Chaos ensues as citizens vanish to unknown planes in a mass.
A portal to the front lines of the Blood War opens in the {@book Lower Ward|SatO|2|Lower Ward}, bringing the conflict to the city.
Dozens of dead factions unite in {@book Undersigil|SatO|2|Undersigil}. They mount an uprising on the surface and attempt to oust several factions.
The Lady of Pain locks the Cage without warning, barring anything and anyone from entering or exiting the City of Doors.
The Lady of Pain decrees that Sigil tolerates its factions no longer. They must disband or risk her wrath. Three factols come together and hire the characters to change the Lady's mind.
table.name: Sigil Calamities

table.caption: Automata Adventures
rows: Fleeing interplanar bounty hunters, a three-horned tiefling named Romerillo (chaotic good, tiefling {@creature spy}) seeks refuge on one of the Upper Planes. Romerillo asks the characters to sneak them aboard the Concordant Express.

Disguised as Serafil, a {@creature shator demodand|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) assumes the council member's position and has the "impostor" arrested. Serafil's disheveled secretary beseeches the characters for aid.

A chaotic evil {@creature quadrone} tampers with the street numbers at night, causing widespread gridlock as modrons leave for work each morning. The Council of Order asks the characters to investigate.

A {@creature marid} fruit vendor is arrested in the Inverse for color-coordinating the produce in their stall. The genie petitions the characters to defend them in the nonsensical courts of the Hall of Discord.
table.name: Automata Adventures

table.caption: Bedlam Adventures
rows: The winds puppeteer the contents of an armory in the Bleakheights. A {@creature goblin} shopkeep pays the characters to defend their shop's wind chimes from rampaging suits of {@creature animated armor}.

Each night, a {@creature darkweaver|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) snatches a resident of Midtown and drags them into the {@book Wailing Hollows|SatO|3|Wailing Hollows}. Gatekeeper Cirrus calls for the creature's capture or extermination.
Orbys Bumblewing asks the characters to test a dubious new flying machine. During their flight, Nimbus Knife {@creature Bandit||bandits} attempt to steal it.
A wave of murder sweeps through Midtown, caused by a malevolent breeze (use the {@creature ghost} stat block) that possesses the townsfolk.
table.name: Bedlam Adventures

table.caption: Curst Adventures
rows: Dolores ({@creature green hag}) pays the characters to remove a group of {@creature Bandit||bandits} from her junkyard.

A disgraced {@creature githzerai uniter|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) in the {@book Traitor's Gate|SatO|3|Traitor's Gate} pays the characters to free Tovus Gilaf from the burgomaster's estate.
A {@creature Mercykiller bloodhound|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) arrives in town, searching for a fugitive who looks exactly like one of the characters.
The gate to Carceri briefly ruptures, releasing a host of destructive {@creature Fomorian||fomorians} on Curst.
table.name: Curst Adventures

table.caption: Ecstasy Adventures
rows: A convincing petitioner (chaotic neutral {@creature ghost}) pretends to be the long-lost relative of a character. The spirit aims to possess the character and live life to the fullest.

The Lightcaller holds a peace banquet in {@book Solrise Tower|SatO|3|Solrise Tower}, inviting powerful devils and demons in hopes of ending the Blood War. A {@creature solar} requests the characters attend in case things turn ugly.

A {@creature green hag} poisons Ecstasy's orchards daily at twilight, outside the jurisdiction of either monarch. After a string of illnesses at {@book Revelhome|SatO|3|Revelhome}, Madame Millani hires the characters to investigate.

Three evenings have passed since the gates of {@book Moondark Tower|SatO|3|Moondark Tower} last opened. An owl-like {@creature avoral guardinal|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) night merchant asks the party to solve the mystery.
table.name: Ecstasy Adventures

table.caption: Excelsior Adventures
rows: An {@creature androsphinx} arrives in Excelsior and declares itself the new high chancellor. Forough petitions the characters to help cement her authority.

The {@creature empyrean} Tygrant receives a prophecy that he can return to Mount Celestia only if he is humbled through defeat. He challenges all of Excelsior, including the characters, to wrestling matches in his tower.

Allowed into the {@book forum|SatO|3|Forum} on an ancient contract, a silver-tongued {@creature pit fiend} invites Excelsior's orators to debate the worth of a soul. An angel asks the characters to take the podium.

The faith of a divine champion ({@creature gladiator}) begins to waver in the {@book Chandelier|SatO|3|Chandelier}, causing their cloud keep to shudder. A {@creature lantern archon|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) asks the characters to erase the warrior's doubt before their fortress falls from the sky.
table.name: Excelsior Adventures

table.caption: Faunel Adventures
rows: Mick Mangehide ({@creature gnoll fang of Yeenoghu}) and his band of {@creature Gnoll||gnolls} set out to claim the hides of Faunel's three pack leaders.
Commanded by a general in Rigus, a {@creature hobgoblin warlord} attempts to capture {@book Camp Greenbriar|SatO|3|Camp Greenbriar} and convert it into a logging camp.
A {@creature musteval guardinal|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) explorer hires the characters to join an expedition to recover a lost treasure from Old Faunel.
An irate {@creature roc} assails Eagles' Aerie, gobbling up its inhabitants and destroying their nests in search of its egg, which was stolen by the Vile Hunt.
table.name: Faunel Adventures

table.caption: Fortitude Adventures
rows: A local politician (dwarf {@creature noble}) pays the characters to dig up dirt on an opponent.

After a series of guilty admissions, {@creature Black Pudding||black puddings} begin to slither from the {@book Pavilion of Purity|SatO|3|Pavilion of Purity} at night, slaying their confessors one by one. The Spotless Seven hires the party to scrub the black puddings from the town.

One of the Storm Lords falls ill with a supernatural cold, plunging Fortitude into a sudden brutal winter. The remaining three elemental beings ask the characters to enter the gate in search of a cure.
A popular candidate for the Spotless Seven convinces several citizens that to achieve inner harmony, they must indulge themselves in one night of unchecked mayhem.
table.name: Fortitude Adventures

table.caption: Glorium Adventures
rows: The town's deceased warriors rise to fight again as {@creature Ghost||ghosts}, but their resurgence creates headaches when the spirit of Flatnose Grim expects to be reinstated as the town's ruler.
After an argument with Tyrza, Jek Thanol refuses to shield Glorium from the armies of Gzemnid. With their treaty shattered, a {@creature death tyrant} attacks the gate-town.

A {@creature frost giant} jarl learns of the entrance to the World Tree within {@book Serpent's Rise|SatO|3|Serpent's Rise}. Rather than attack Glorium, he sets out to find the root and use it to conquer untold worlds.
A {@creature sea hag} in the {@book Sacred Well|SatO|3|Sacred Well} tells one of the characters they will die at the hand of Gzemnid in five days.
table.name: Glorium Adventures

table.caption: Hopeless Adventures
rows: The party is caught red-handed after a mean-spirited {@creature goblin} makeup artist ambushes them with a splash of magic paint. Two {@creature Beholder||beholders} demand the characters perform at the {@book Gallows|SatO|3|Gallows} or be disintegrated where they stand.
Commanded by its superiors in Hades, a {@creature nycaloth} bubbles up through the Wishless Well and begins hunting members of the resistance in Hopeless.
High Cardinal Thingol hires the characters to catch the Jester, a costumed vigilante ({@creature mage}) in possession of a wand that spreads joy.
A {@creature baernaloth|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) whispers to the characters through the Wishless Well, offering to trade ancient secrets for the Maiden of Misery's true identity.
table.name: Hopeless Adventures

table.caption: Plague-Mort Adventures
rows: Disguised as a cleric of a sun god, a {@creature deva} from Excelsior begins proselytizing among hopeful townsfolk in secret. Archlector Bex commands the characters to capture the missionary and deliver them to the Pit.
A farmer pays the characters to prune a patch of pustules from a field before the harvest is spoiled. Dozens of {@creature Zombie||zombies} lurk within the maze of stalks.

Armed with a forked spear, the vindictive Martari Mayhem (lawful evil, tiefling {@creature gladiator}) plans to storm {@book Blightsteel Keep|SatO|3|Blightsteel Keep}. At the {@book Razed Altar|SatO|3|Razed Altar}, she hires the characters to infiltrate the stronghold and report on its defenses.

Alorio Nightriddle (chaotic evil, human {@creature mage}) invites the characters to a clandestine meeting at A Pinch of Salt, a rundown tavern with a {@creature glabrezu} proprietor. Alorio wants their help to oust the archlector.
table.name: Plague-Mort Adventures

table.caption: Ribcage Adventures
rows: One of the character's loved ones pledges their soul in an infernal contract. To win it back, the party must argue their case before a {@creature pit fiend} judge in the Court of Cinders.

Commanded by a fallen angel (lawful evil {@creature planetar}) who runs a rival tavern, a gaggle of {@creature Imp||imps} begins vandalizing the {@book Bleeding Horn|SatO|3|Bleeding Horn}. The {@creature ice devil} Sparax pays characters to deal with the situation.

Thalamra Vanthampur, a deceased duke of Baldur's Gate, claws her way out of the depths of Avernus and emerges in Ribcage as a {@creature death knight}. A vengeful conqueror, she calls on the characters to help topple Duchess Zurkbane and her cronies.
Duchess Zurkbane hires the characters to capture a supposedly dangerous criminal, who turns out to be an innocent {@creature commoner} who saw Zurkbane's true form.
table.name: Ribcage Adventures

table.caption: Rigus Adventures
rows: The {@creature arcanaloth} Fetchtatter pays the characters to steal an infernal war machine from {@book Ribcage|SatO|3|Ribcage} so it can be sold to a general in Rigus.
The avatar of an evil deity of war (use the {@creature planar incarnate|MPP} stat block from {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) emerges from the {@book Lion's Gate|SatO|3|Gate} to destroy Rigus.
A {@creature mummy lord} in the {@book Crown|SatO|3|Crown} commands General Braahg to implement an outdated strategy. Risking treason, the hobgoblin hires the characters to lay his superior to rest.

The {@creature ghost} of a fallen warrior asks the party to investigate why their name isn't on the {@book Final Procession|SatO|3|Final Procession}. The culprit is a petty Crown General who took credit for the warrior's heroism.
table.name: Rigus Adventures

table.caption: Sylvania Adventures
rows: A {@creature vampire} bachelorette invites the characters to a costumed ball at the {@book Yearning Timbers|SatO|3|Yearning Timbers}, hoping to enlist their help in choosing her next partner.
A jolly halfling invites the characters to a tea party at their woodland cottage. The halfling is actually a {@creature green hag} intent on eating her guests.
A {@creature blink dog} gobbles up King Ewren III. As the kingdom descends into chaos, a {@creature pixie} messenger asks the characters to help determine the next monarch.
One of the Seven Spiritors (use the {@creature ghost} stat block) possesses a {@creature satyr} and involves the characters in a scandal that must be remedied.
table.name: Sylvania Adventures

table.caption: Torch Adventures
rows: When a buyer stiffs the Stolen Glance, Zephesta hires the characters to collect the debt and "rough him up a little bit." She fails to mention the buyer is a {@creature cloud giant}.
A {@creature death tyrant} claiming to be the deceased founder of the Xanathar's Guild on Toril hires the party to obtain an invitation to the Family on its behalf—or be destroyed.

The {@book Bank of Abbathor|SatO|3|Bank of Abbathor} hires the characters as security. The very same day, two {@creature Maelephant|MPP|maelephants} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}) attempt to rob the bank.
{@creature Doppelganger||Doppelgangers} in the Lookalikes gang take on the characters' appearances and go on a crime spree, creating problems for the party at multiple locations.
table.name: Torch Adventures

table.caption: Tradegate Adventures
rows: While the characters are shopping, several hostile {@creature xorn} attack the {@book Trademill Mint|SatO|3|Trademill Mint}.
During a demonstration for the characters, a gnome inventor's latest creation (use the {@creature iron golem} stat block) runs amok, wreaking havoc.

Melvin Manyroads (chaotic good, gnome {@creature mage}) asks the characters to help map one of the many sites in the Outlands (see the "{@book Other Realms|SatO|3|Other Realms}" section later in this chapter).

A local beekeeper wants to sell a special planar honey in the {@book Everything Emporium|SatO|3|Everything Emporium}. To help her get started, the beekeeper asks the characters to capture {@dice 1d10} live {@creature Sunfly|MPP|sunflies} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}).
table.name: Tradegate Adventures

table.caption: Xaos Adventures
rows: A team of four {@creature Quadrone||quadrones} recruits the party on a rescue mission into the {@book Cube|SatO|3|The Cube}.
Lazethon, a {@creature githzerai uniter|MPP} (see {@book Morte's Planar Parade|MPP}), recruits the characters to defend the embassy from an approaching githyanki warship.

A merciless {@creature githyanki knight} arrives in Xaos on the back of a {@creature young red dragon}. He asks the characters to help him sniff out members of the Sha'sal Khou on behalf of Vlaakith the Lich-Queen.
Slaadi flock to their nest in Xaos for a ritual that occurs once every century. Afraid of becoming hosts for {@creature Slaad Tadpole||slaad tadpoles}, townsfolk beseech the characters for aid.
table.name: Xaos Adventures

table.caption: Heralds of Dust Spellcasting Fees
rows: {@spell Animate dead}, {@spell feign death}, {@spell speak with dead}
table.name: Heralds of Dust Spellcasting Fees

table.caption: Mortuary Chambers
rows: A storage room for objects bequeathed by the dead
A cramped, tenement-like catacomb housing for sapient Undead who live and work in Sigil
A scriptorium for epitaphs, eulogies, and obituaries
A filthy room filled with mounds of grave dirt
A cadaver room where maimed Undead can peruse replacement limbs
A craft room for caskets, ships, and other containers used in funerary ceremonies
A ritual chamber affected by a permanent {@spell hallow} spell
A reception hall that smells of funeral potatoes
An autopsy room lined with surgical instruments
table.name: Exploring the Mortuary; Mortuary Chambers

table.caption: Mortuary Adventure Hooks
rows: A wrongfully interred {@creature death knight} launches a campaign against Factol Skall, fomenting dissent and dividing the Heralds of Dust into splinter factions. Factol Skall hires the characters to unite the dead before the faction crumbles beyond repair.

A multiversal law dictates that a death council must convene in the Mortuary once every century. The characters are charged with exhuming a series of influential Undead entombed on other planes and escorting them to the Mortuary. Some of the council members are especially cranky when awoken.
When a godling is born on the Upper Planes, a wave of positive energy sweeps over the Mortuary through its myriad portals, restoring hundreds of long-dead creatures to life.
{@creature Factol Skall|AATM} (see the appendix) announces his retirement. Before he transcends to True Death, he asks the characters to help him name his successor.
table.name: Mortuary Adventures; Mortuary Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Animated Coffin Contents
rows: A patch of {@hazard yellow mold} (see the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG})
A portal to the {@area Path of Graves|02a|x} (detailed earlier in this supplement)
table.name: Animated Coffin Contents

table.caption: Inspiration Cards
rows: When you deal damage to a creature, immediately spend 1 Hit Die to heal yourself. Roll the die, add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of hit points equal to the total (minimum 1).

As a bonus action, select one creature as your chosen foe. That creature has vulnerability to damage you deal and resistance to all other damage, and it has disadvantage on its attack rolls against any creature other than you. This effect ends when any creature other than you deals damage to the target.

As an action, you are transported to an empty demiplane until the end of your next turn. You can't affect or be affected by anything on the plane you left until you return. You return to the same space you left or, if that space is occupied, to the nearest unoccupied space.
When a creature makes a saving throw, it has disadvantage on that saving throw.
Reroll a single {@dice d20} roll you've just made. You must use the second roll.
When you deal damage to a creature, that creature takes an extra {@dice 1d6} fire damage.
As a reaction, when you take damage, you cause the creature that dealt it to have the {@condition prone} condition.
Take an additional action on your turn.
Take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action.
As a bonus action, teleport, with anything you are wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to a space you can see.
As a reaction, impose disadvantage on the attack roll of a creature you can see.
As a bonus action, regain one expended 1st-level spell slot or a single use of an ability that can be used a certain number of times per day.
Gain advantage on a saving throw.
Gain advantage on an attack roll.
As a bonus action, impose disadvantage on all ability checks of a creature you can see until the end of its next turn.
Take the {@action Help} or {@action Search} action as a bonus action.
As an action, surround yourself with a shroud of death. Until the start of your next turn, any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you takes {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage.
Gain advantage on an ability check.
As a reaction, when a creature makes a melee attack that hits you, that creature has the {@condition blinded} condition until the end of your next turn.
As a bonus action, reduce the speed of one creature within 5 feet of you to 0 until the start of your next turn.
As a reaction, when you take damage, the creature that dealt the damage has the {@condition frightened} condition until the end of its next turn. You are the source of its fear.
As a reaction, when you take damage, gain resistance to that damage until the start of your next turn.
table.name: Inspiration Hand; Inspiration Cards
